articles.title: How the James Webb Space Telescope's first colour images were made
articles.description: Joseph DePasquale, the lead image processor for the James Webb Space Telescope, says seeing its first colour image was an "overwhelming" experience
articles.content:
By Will Gater
The James Webb Space Telescope is designed to capture infrared light from galaxies that formed in the early Universe
NASA/Desiree Stover
Later today, President Joe Biden will unveil … [+388 chars]

articles.title: Three-eyed predator stalked the seas 500 million years ago
articles.description: Stanleycaris hirpex, which lived in the Cambrian period, had two protruding eyes on the side of its head and a larger eye in the centre
articles.content:
By Christa Lesté-Lasserre
A reconstruction of Stanleycaris hirpex
Sabrina Cappelli © Royal Ontario Museum
A three-eyed animal with wing-like fins once swam through shallow seas, using heightened v… [+2426 chars]

articles.title: Infertility in some men may be caused by X chromosome mutations
articles.description: An international study has identified more than 50 genes on the X chromosome in which mutations may cause poor sperm production
articles.content:
By Christa Lesté-Lasserre
A sperm sample with low numbers of sperm
JAMES KING-HOLMES/SCIENCE PHOTO LIBRARY
An international study has identified more than 50 genes on the X chromosome in which mut… [+3155 chars]

articles.title: UK's latest omicron wave being driven by BA.4 and BA.5 covid variants
articles.description: The latest coronavirus figures from the UK's Office for National Statistics show that around 2.7 million people had covid-19 in the week ending 29 June, as the highly transmissible omicron subvariants BA.4 and BA.5 drive infections
articles.content:
By Clare Wilson
Commuters in London, UK in June, a month which saw rising covid-19 infection rates
Luke MacGregor/Bloomberg via Getty Images
One in 25 people in England or nearly 4 per cent of the… [+348 chars]

articles.title: Gel-coated battery could stop mobile phones catching fire or exploding
articles.description: A cheap and easily manufactured material can act as a thermal conductor at low temperatures and an insulator at high temperatures, which may help prevent dramatic battery fires and explosions
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
Traditional lithium-ion batteries can overheatLithium-ion batteries used in smartphones and other devices are susceptible to catching fire and even exploding if they begin to over… [+477 chars]

articles.title: World's most sensitive dark matter detector tested for the first time
articles.description: A brief test has proven that the new LUX-ZEPLIN dark matter detector is the most sensitive ever. It may be our best bet for finally finding dark matter particles
articles.content:
By Leah Crane
The LUX-ZEPLIN dark matter detector at the Sanford Underground Research Facility in South Dakota is the most sensitive ever
Matthew Kapust/Sanford Underground Research Facility
The s… [+2210 chars]

articles.title: Southern fin whales have recovered to large numbers in the Antarctic
articles.description: Aerial surveys have found groups of up to 150 fin whales feeding near Antarctica, a sign that populations have bounced back since since the 1976 ban on hunting these whales
articles.content:
By Jason Arunn Murugesu
A fin whale near Elephant Island, Antarctica
Dan Beecham
Large groups of southern fin whales (Balaenoptera physalus quoyi) have been seen in the Antarctic for the first tim… [+1713 chars]

articles.title: Meraxes gigas was a huge dinosaur with tiny arms like T. rex
articles.description: A dinosaur discovered in Argentina has been identified as a new species. Meraxes gigas lived 20 million years before T. rex, but had a similarly large body, sharp teeth and proportionately small arms
articles.content:
By Corryn Wetzel
An artist’s illustration of the recently unearthed Meraxes gigas dinosaur
Carlos Papolio
A relatively recently discovered dinosaur species, Meraxes gigas, had a giant body and sma… [+2348 chars]

articles.title: Optimising crop genetics could double global wheat production
articles.description: Optimising the wheat genome could help us double yields of the crop, according to plant scientists – although other researchers say they are being too optimistic
articles.content:

Wheat being turned into hay – it may be possible to significantly increase wheat yields using genetics

articles.title: The James Webb Space Telescope heralds a new era for astronomy
articles.description: We are about to get our hands on the first observations from the world’s most powerful space telescope - and it’s a moment to savour
